column4: anyone in here have an xps1330 or a N wlan card in there laptop, mine is an intel PRO/Wireless 4965 802.11n but ubuntu is only connecting at a G rate.  The N connectioned worked fine in windows
anyone have a Intel PRO/Wireless 4965 NIC in there laptop ?
I dont know how to get my Intel PRO/Wireless 4965 to connect using 802.11N
the router is N and it connected to N under windows, but in Ubunutu is stuck in G
linux does not support N as wols_ already said
whichever you please usually something under /media/ ( /media/iso for example )
you will have to create the dir beforehand (sudo mkdir /media/iso )
a mount point is a directory of the filesystem nothing more nothing less
there is no need for such a thing in ubuntu
mostly. "sudo apt-get clean" from time to time
sorry but a more usefull man page is the one of the pager used by default to see them "man less"
